comments:
In the snippet below, the two values "myProjectName" are initially set to the
project's name.  If the project name gets changed, this file is not updated
properly.  This causes confusion when configuring projects to run on a Server
module when the expected project name does not appear in the list.  This file
should probably be rebuilt when a project gets renamed.

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<project-modules id="moduleCoreId">
<wb-module deploy-name="myProjectName">
<module-type module-type-id="jst.web">
<version>2.4</version>
<property name="context-root" value="myProjectName"/>
<property name="java-output-path" value="/bin/"/>
</module-type>
<wb-resource deploy-path="/WEB-INF/classes" source-path="/JavaSource"/>
<wb-resource deploy-path="/" source-path="/WebContent"/>
</wb-module>
</project-modules>

The refactoring actions will be added as a part of enhancement 92426.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 92426 ***

I have seen a similar problem when I do Copy and then Paste the Navigator with an existing project that is tied to a Server deploy action.  To reproduce:

1) Create a new web project and put something in it that can be deployed and run.

2) Add the project to a server launch configuration (say by running a jsp page in the new project).  I am using a Tomcat 5.5 server configuration; don't know if that has any impact.

3) Now copy and paste the project.  You will prompted to rename the new project so that it doesn't conflict with the existing one.  Rename it something and accept.

You should now have two projects called X and X_ for the sake of argument that are identical except for the name.

4) Try to deploy a JSP in  X_ and you will get an error dialog that "The selection is not with a valid module".

5) Try to add the project to the server configuration by right-clicking on the configuration in the Servers view and you will not see X_.  Instead, you will see X twice in the list.

The project is now unusable for launch purposes AFAIS.  When I tried to work around the problem by editting the .settings/org.eclipse.wst.commmon.core.prefs file to use the correct name in the wb-module "deploy" node, it just made things worse and I start getting exceptions:

java.lang.NullPointerException
at org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.internal.common.classpath.J2EEComponentClasspathUpdater.findNode(J2EEComponentClasspathUpdater.java:500)
at org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.internal.common.classpath.J2EEComponentClasspathUpdater.findNode(J2EEComponentClasspathUpdater.java:503)
at org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.internal.common.classpath.J2EEComponentClasspathUpdater.findNode(J2EEComponentClasspathUpdater.java:503)
at org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.internal.common.classpath.J2EEComponentClasspathUpdater.resourceChanged(J2EEComponentClasspathUpdater.java:461)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.NotificationManager$2.run(NotificationManager.java:282)
at org.eclipse.core.runtime.SafeRunner.run(SafeRunner.java:37)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.NotificationManager.notify(NotificationManager.java:276)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.NotificationManager.broadcastChanges(NotificationManager.java:148)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.broadcastPostChange(Workspace.java:257)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.endOperation(Workspace.java:964)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run(Workspace.java:1752)
at org.eclipse.ui.ide.undo.AbstractWorkspaceOperation.execute(AbstractWorkspaceOperation.java:208)
at org.eclipse.core.commands.operations.DefaultOperationHistory.execute(DefaultOperationHistory.java:509)
at org.eclipse.ui.actions.DeleteResourceAction$3.run(DeleteResourceAction.java:488)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

The copy is now completely fubarred.  Either way, taking a copy of a dynamic project doesn't work.

A refactor rename is supported; copy & paste does not produce the same events as a rename - this is a dup of an existing bug on that topic

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 157748 ***
